Eureka Episode Guide





1. Pilot

First aired: 7/18/2006
Writer: Andrew Cosby, Jaime Paglia
Director: Peter O'Fallon
Guest star: Shayn Solberg (Spencer Martin), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Maury Chaykin (Sheriff William Cobb), Rob LaBelle (Walter Perkins), Zak Ludwig (Brian Perkins), Jennifer Clement (Susan Perkins), Benjamin B. Smith (Oppenheimer Boy), Jocelyne Loewen (Doris Gelmer), Ian Carter (Special Agent), Bryan Wilson (Baker Brother #2 & #4), Kwesi Ameyaw (Special Agent Hicks), Chris Burns (Force Recon Commando Buzz), Keith Wilson (Baker Brother #1 & #3), Garry Chalk (Colonel Briggs)
Global rating: 8.9

A car accident leads U.S. Marshal Jack Carter into the unique Pacific Northwest town of Eureka.

After a strange accident sidelines Eureka's sheriff, Jack Carter takes over the investigation into the mysterious phenomenon that led to the death of a resident.

Carter learns about the secret purpose of the town while trying to re-establish a connection with his angry and bitter daughter, Zoe. He develops a friendly working relationship with government liaison Allison Blake and meets some of the more eccentric residents of Eureka.

2. Many Happy Returns

First aired: 7/25/2006
Writer: Andrew Cosby
Director: Jefery Levy
Guest star: Zak Ludwig (Brian Perkins), Rob LaBelle (Walter Perkins), Jennifer Clement (Susan Perkins)
Global rating: 8.8

Carter and the other citizens of Eureka attend the funeral of Susan and Walter Perkins. Much to their surprise, Susan makes a return to Eureka as a woman who is very much alive!

3. Before I Forget

First aired: 8/1/2006
Writer: Karl Schaefer, John Rogers
Director: Michael Robison
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Tamlyn Tomita (Kim Anderson) , Amber Borycki (Cybernetic Fairy), Ken Yanko (Lt. General), Ryan Vrba (Puck), Samuel Patrick Chu (Putnam), Andrew Airlie (Jason Anderson)
Global rating: 8.8

Jack Carter accidentally shoots Henry while suffering from short-term memory loss. A visit from a noted scientist may hold clues into Carter's sudden memory loss.

4. Alienated

First aired: 8/8/2006
Writer: Betsy Landis, Varina Bleil, Dan E. Fesman, Harry Victor
Director: Marita Grabiak
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Shayn Solberg (Spencer Martin) , Layla Alizada (Dr. Sharat), Daryl Shuttleworth (Global Security Tactical Commander), Garwin Sanford (Congressman Arnold Faraday)
Global rating: 8.6

Spencer is apparently abducted by aliens and then returned to Earth the next day inside a crop circle. Also, the town is visited by Congressman Arnold Faraday, whose committee is responsible for Eureka's government funding.

5. Invincible

First aired: 8/15/2006
Writer: Dan E. Fesman
Director: Michael Grossman
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Shayn Solberg (Spencer Martin) , Saul Rubinek (Dr. Carl Carlson)
Global rating: 8.8

After a lab accident, Global Dynamics researcher Carl Carlson is expelled from Eureka due to lack of results. Later, it is discovered that the accident has unlocked hidden abilities in Carl. Meanwhile, Jack does his best to avoid a physical.

6. Dr. Nobel

First aired: 8/22/2006
Writer: Harry Victor, Dan E. Fesman
Director: Jeff Woolnough
Guest star: Shayn Solberg (Spencer Martin), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Antony Holland (Dr. Irvin Horatio Thatcher), John Burnside (Scientist Teaching Zoe #2), Bryan Wilson (Baker Twin #1), Keith Wilson (Baker Twin #2), Donna White (Eugenia), Aaron Rota, Tyla Gagnon (Young Eugenia), Jocelyne Loewen (Doris Stokes), Mark Burgess, John Burnside (Scientist Teaching Zoe), Matthew McInnis (Young Thatcher), Colin Foo (Scientist Teaching Zoe #1)
Global rating: 8.9

After Fargo and Spencer accidentally activate a doomsday device, Carter must help Dr. Irwin Thatcher, an aging scientist, to shut down the machine.

7. Blink

First aired: 8/29/2006
Writer: Andrew Cosby, Jaime Paglia
Director: Jefery Levy
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Shayn Solberg (Spencer Martin) , Katie Chapman (Cheerleader #2), Laura Adkin (Courtney), Graham Young (Jockey), Nathan Kelly (Nerd), Gary Sekhon (Kellor), David Quinlan (Dr. Milton Houk), Tom Tames (Dylan Hartwell)
Global rating: 8.8

Carter investigates an unusual car accident. Meanwhile, Stark is under stress to produce results on a project.

8. Right as Raynes

First aired: 9/5/2006
Writer: Johanna Stokes
Director: Mike Rohl
Guest star: Shayn Solberg (Spencer Martin), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Robert Clarke (II) (Larry), Sean Devine, Alex Diakun, David Paetkau (Callister Raynes)
Global rating: 8.8

When the return of Eureka's star pupil causes problems all over town, Stark is forced to make a hard choice. Carter attempts to track down Zoe who has run off with the former resident.

9. Primal

First aired: 9/12/2006
Writer: Johanna Stokes, Karl Schaefer, Martin Weiss, Martin Weiss
Director: Colin Bucksey
Guest star: Shayn Solberg (Spencer Martin), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Aleks Paunovic (Global Security Officer), Robert Clarke (II) (Larry), Rukiya Bernard (IT Technician)
Global rating: 8.7

A nanotech experiment escapes from Global Dynamics. The project, which bridges the gap between computers and human brains, threatens to overrun Eureka when it begins duplicating Stark.

10. Purple Haze

First aired: 9/19/2006
Writer: Jaime Paglia, Andrew Cosby, Johanna Stokes
Director: David Straiton
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Bryan Wilson (Baker Twin #1), Keith Wilson (Baker Twin #2), Michael Benyaer (Dr. Louis Glazier), Alan Legros (Seth Osbourne)
Global rating: 9.1

Sheriff Carter and Zoe are the only ones unaffected when Eureka's residents begin to behave strangely. The father and daughter team search for the cause.

11. H.O.U.S.E. Rules

First aired: 9/26/2006
Writer: Harry Victor
Director: Jeff Woonough
Guest star: Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Michael Robert Coleman (Pizza Delivery Guy), Arthur Corber (Scientist in Explosion)
Global rating: 9.1

S.A.R.A.H. — the artificial intelligence that runs Carter's house — takes him and a group of residents hostage in an intervention to keep Carter in Eureka. Meanwhile, S.A.R.A.H.'s root program B.R.A.D. activates and turns the situation deadly.

12. Once in a Lifetime

First aired: 10/3/2006
Writer: Johanna Stokes, Jaime Paglia, Andrew Cosby, Andrew Cosby, Jaime Paglia
Director: Michael Lange
Guest star: Tamlyn Tomita (Kim Anderson), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , J.R. Messado (Kevin Blake), Keith Wilson (Baker Twin #2), Bryan Wilson (Baker Twin #1), Aaron Isaacs (Walter Perkins)
Global rating: 9.3

Following an experiment on the artifact, Eureka warps to 2010. However, temporal anomalies begin to cause problems for Eureka, which leads to a shocking revelation.

13. Phoenix Rising

First aired: 7/10/2007
Writer: Jaime Paglia
Director: Mike Rohl
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Debrah Farentino (Beverly Barlowe), Matt Frewer (Jim Taggart), Tamlyn Tomita (Kim Anderson), Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Paul Christie (Ryan Brock), Stephen Powell (Robert Matthew), Raugi Yu (Wayne Kwan), Reese Alexander (Security Officer), Michael Kopsa (Doctor), J.B. McEown (Kid), Cameron Park (Rob Matthew), Sharon Taylor (II), Garwin Sanford (Congressman Arnold Faraday)
Global rating: 9.2

Reaccustoming to the timeline restored in "Once in a Lifetime", Sheriff Carter investigates a series of sudden deaths.

14. Try, Try Again

First aired: 7/17/2007
Writer: Charlie Craig
Director: Michael Nankin
Guest star: Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Debrah Farentino (Beverly Barlowe), Barclay Hope (General Mansfield) , Vincent Gale (Dr. Todd), Don Thompson (Victor), Richard Arndt, Tyronne L'Hirondelle (Security Guard)
Global rating: 9.0

Carter and Stark are forced to team up when Global Dynamics is threatened by an expanding personal forcefield.

15. Unpredictable

First aired: 7/24/2007
Writer: Thania St. John
Director: Robert Lieberman
Guest star: Adrienne Carter (Pilar), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake), Debrah Farentino (Beverly Barlowe), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , David Nykl (Dr. Stephen Whiticus), Stefanie von Pfetten (Wendy Whiticus), Olivia d'Abo (Abby Carter), Patrick Gilmore (Pete Puhlman), Max Fomitchev (Neil Baker), Bryan Wilson (Baker Brother #2 & #4), Keith Wilson (Baker Brother #1 & #3)
Global rating: 9.0

An isolated deep freeze trigger causes a chain reaction of sudden weather changes in Eureka.

16. Games People Play

First aired: 7/31/2007
Writer: Johanna Stokes
Director: Mike Rohl
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Olivia d'Abo (Abby Carter), Syn Narula (Dr. Babajanian), Ed Hong-Louie, Michael Kopsa (Doctor), Sharon Taylor (II), Cameron Park (Doctor)
Global rating: 8.9

After receiving a hit to the head, Carter finds that he is in a parallel Eureka. He discovers that the residents of the parallel Eureka are mysteriously disappearing.

17. Duck, Duck Goose

First aired: 8/7/2007
Writer: Ethan Lawrence
Director: Michael Lange
Guest star: Matt Frewer (Jim Taggart), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Karissa Tynes (Stephanie), Brenda Crichlow (Principal Judy Wallace), Matreya Fedor (Tina), Anna Galvin (Dr. Jane Harrington), Elise Gatien (Megan Harrington), David Lewis (IV) (Dr. Aaron Finn), Jordan Asch
Global rating: 8.8

Space debris threatens Eureka after it accumulates into a large cloud. Carter investigates in an effort to avert potential disaster.

18. Noche de Sueños

First aired: 8/14/2007
Writer: Jaime Paglia
Director: Eric Laneuville
Guest star: Adrienne Carter (Pilar), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , James Ashcroft, Michael Bean, Lossen Chambers, Martin Christopher, Daniel Boileau, Tanya Champoux, Laura Jaszcz, Nancy J. Lilley, Mary Alison Raine, Donna Yamamoto, Fulvio Cecere (Jake Wyatt), Colin Cunningham (Dr. Paul Sueños), Carmen Moore (Dr. Karen Childress)
Global rating: 9.2

The denizens of Eureka are experiencing shared dreams. What is considered humorous at first soon takes a dire turn for the worse.

19. Family Reunion

First aired: 8/21/2007
Writer: Jane Espenson, Anne Cofell Saunders
Director: Michael Lange
Guest star: Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Tygh Runyan (Dr. Pierre Fargo), Scott Hylands (Dr. Andre Sandrov), Terence Kelly (Charles Kindry), Deirdre Blades (Belle St. John), Jerry Springer (Himself), Martin Christopher, Kevin O'Grady
Global rating: 9.0

Douglas Fargo's grandfather, Pierre, is accidentally awakened from his cryogenic slumber. However, Pierre makes it clear that he was not willingly "frozen".

20. E=MC...?

First aired: 8/28/2007
Writer: Bruce Miller (II)
Director: Tim Matheson
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Niall Matter (Zane Donovan), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Rob Hayter, Allison Hossack (Dr. Emily Glenn), Bill Mondy (Sam Lovejoy), Gabrielle Rose (Carol Taylor), Michael Brock (Jasper Cole), Paul Herbert (II), Patrick Keating, Dave Leach, Stephen Park, Storma Sire, Myfanwy Meilen, Sarah Hayward
Global rating: 9.1

An experiment to recreate the big bang seems to be causing Eureka's finest to become dumber and dumber, including everyone involved in the experiment. When it comes to the verge of destroying Global Dynamics, the fate of the town lies in the hands of Jack Carter and the team of scientists he assembles, amongst them the newest member of the town, an anti-social genius.

21. Sight Unseen

First aired: 9/4/2007
Writer: Thania St. John, Charlie Craig
Director: Donna Deitch
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake), Vanya Asher (Lucas) , Sonja Bennett (Callie Curie), Michael Brock (Jasper Cole), Iris Paluly, David Stuart (Pharmacist), Karissa Tynes (Stephanie), Adam Bergquist (Mr. Hall), Paul Moniz de Sa (Lincoln), Mike Power
Global rating: 8.9

Strange happenings and spreading radiation at Global Dynamics lead to speculations that an abandoned research project concerning invisibility might have been revived. When Sheriff Carter accidentally becomes involved, the effects of invisibility threaten his life.

22. God Is in the Details

First aired: 9/11/2007
Writer: Eric Wallace
Director: Mike Rohl
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Niall Matter (Zane Donovan), Adrienne Carter (Pilar), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake) , Teryl Rothery (Diane Lancaster), Alan Legros (Seth Osbourne), Barbara Eve Harris (Reverend Harper), Dorla Bell, Anna Cummer, Alison Araya, Nhi Do
Global rating: 8.1

A series of strange events causes Eureka's residents to worry that a biblical plague may be upon them.

23. Maneater

First aired: 9/18/2007
Writer: Bruce Miller (II)
Director: Michael Robison
Guest star: Matt Frewer (Jim Taggart), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Niall Matter (Zane Donovan) , Sonja Bennett (Callie Curie), Lexa Doig (Anne Young), Richard Ian Cox (Dr. Bob "The Mole" Stone), Eileen Barrett (Mrs. Stone), Maria Luisa Cianni, Eric Hui
Global rating: 9.1

The women of Eureka become infatuated with Sheriff Carter, who they find irresistible.

24. All That Glitters (1)

First aired: 9/25/2007
Writer: Thania St. John
Director: Michael Grossman
Guest star: Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake), Debrah Farentino (Beverly Barlowe), Niall Matter (Zane Donovan), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Michael Shanks (Christopher Dactylos), Steve Makaj (Rudolph), Sonja Bennett (Callie Curie), Daniel Pepper (D.O.D. Agent)
Global rating: 9.0

Eureka faces an inexplicable quandary when metal objects—and people too—begin turning to gold.

25. A Night at Global Dynamics (2)

First aired: 10/2/2007
Writer: Jaime Paglia
Director: Michael Lange
Guest star: Debrah Farentino (Beverly Barlowe), Matt Frewer (Jim Taggart), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Niall Matter (Zane Donovan), Barclay Hope (General Mansfield), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake) , Sean Millington (G.D. Security Officer)
Global rating: 8.9

Global Dynamics goes into lockdown to protect itself from the now airborne metal-eating bacteria. Stuck inside GD, Sheriff Carter and Stark must work together to save both the town and Kevin, Alison's son.

26. Bad to the Drone

First aired: 7/29/2008
Writer: Jaime Paglia
Director: Bryan Spicer
Guest star: Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Barclay Hope (General Mansfield), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Kirsten Robek (Mina), Jonathon Young (Dr. Ethan Edison)
Global rating: 8.7

Eureka is threatened by an intelligent drone with "issues" after an anti-missile test. Meanwhile, Eva Thorne, nicknamed "The Fixer", after dismantling and rebuilding several corporations, arrives in Eureka to evaluate Global Dynamics' expenditures.

27. What About Bob?

First aired: 8/5/2008
Writer: Charlie Craig
Director: Fred Gerber
Guest star: Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Vanya Asher (Lucas) , Malcolm Stewart (Rick Wallace), Richard Kahan (Derek Bowers), Woody Jeffreys (Bob Nobb), Jaclyn Smith (II) (Grace), Elysia Rotaru (Teri Wallace), Neil Schell (Abe Jensen), Patricia Harras (Laura Wallace)
Global rating: 8.8

Sheriff Carter and Allison investigate the disappearance of a scientist from a sealed biosphere. Meanwhile, "The Fixer" attempts to make Eureka's ventures more profitable.

28. Best in Faux

First aired: 8/12/2008
Writer: Bruce Miller (II)
Director: Paul Holohan
Guest star: Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Alan Ruck (Dr. Hood), Lexa Doig (Dr. Anne Young), Gabrielle Rose (Carol Taylor), Holly Dignard (Dr. Tracy Fox), Shawn MacDonald (Dr. Mendel), Kayla Deorksen (Sales Lady)
Global rating: 8.9

The town's annual dog show gets into full swing—complete with exploding robotic canines. Meanwhile, Sheriff Carter experiences an isolated earthquake, Zoe contemplates quitting the accelerated physics program, and Allison starts fitting her wedding dress.

29. I Do Over

First aired: 8/19/2008
Writer: Thania St. John
Director: Matt Earl Beesley
Guest star: Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Meshach Peters (Kevin Blake), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Paul Moniz de Sa (Lincoln), Nicholas Carella (Leo Weinbrenner), Bridget Hoffman (Computer Voice)
Global rating: 9.4

On Allison and Stark's wedding day, Sheriff Carter finds himself stuck in a time loop, causing him to experience the same lousy day over and over again. Meanwhile, Sheriff Carter's sister Lexi visits Eureka.

30. Show Me the Mummy

First aired: 8/26/2008
Writer: Curtis Kheel
Director: Ernest Dickerson
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne) , Adrian Hough (Dr. Wilding), Zak Santiago (Dr. Sebastian Marx/Paco Lopez), Tricia Collins (Eileen Michaels)
Global rating: 8.8

When an Egyptian tomb is opened at Global Dynamics, strange things start to happen, leading Fargo to believe it is the mummy's curse. The mummy, however, has disappeared, and Carter investigates.

31. Phased and Confused

First aired: 9/9/2008
Writer: Nick Wauters
Director: Michael Robison
Guest star: Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne), Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Adrienne Carter (Pilar) , Mark Hildreth (Chuck), Jody Racicot (Doctor Peterson), David Mackay (Doctor Gaz), Kaaren de Zilva (Doctor Lee)
Global rating: 8.7

A mysterious "superhero" who can walk through walls is causing a ruckus in Eureka. Meanwhile, Zoe and her friends become stranded with Zane Donovan in an abandoned subterranean facility.

32. Here Come the Suns

First aired: 9/16/2008
Writer: Eric Wallace, Jaime Paglia
Director: Oz Scott
Guest star: Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Dean Marshall (Dr. Herrera), Margot Berner (Kylie)
Global rating: 9.0

The town's mayoral race is disrupted when Zoe's science partner inadvertently causes a second sun to appear over Eureka.

33. From Fear to Eternity

First aired: 9/23/2008
Writer: Thania St. John
Director: Eric Laneuville
Guest star: Frances Fisher (Eva Thorne), Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Barclay Hope (General Mansfield), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , David Richmond-Peck (Dr. Hendricks), Julius Chapple (Section 5 Guard), Bridget Hoffman (Computer Voice)
Global rating: 9.1

As Eva Thorne prepares to seal off the subterranean military complex, Zoe's life is endangered as her body begins to rapidly age.

34. Welcome Back, Carter

First aired: 7/10/2009
Writer: Bruce Miller (II)
Director: Matthew Diamond
Guest star: Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.), Barclay Hope (General Mansfield), Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Kurt Max Runte (Agent Turner), Kevin James (II) (Dr. Fielding), Kim Poirier (Dr. Maria Leonardo), Ty Olsson (Sheriff Andy)
Global rating: 9.2

Following his sacking in "From Fear to Eternity", Carter attends a job interview with the Department of Homeland Security. Deputy Lupo hands in her resignation on learning her new boss is a robot.

35. Your Face or Mine

First aired: 7/17/2009
Writer: Jaime Paglia
Director: Colin Ferguson
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman) , Martin Christopher (Doctor), Bridget Hoffman (Computer Voice), Leela Savasta (Julia Golden), Tobias Slezak (Dr. Jacob Stefano), Julia Arkos (Dr. Bella Pagani)
Global rating: 8.8

It is time for physical exams for the Sheriff's department and an upgrade for the town's security system, both Eureka-styled by Global Dynamics. Acting Sheriff Lupo seems almost loopy after the 48 hour extreme exam, and she volunteers to a DNA scan for the new security system, but then a malfunction occurs.

36. Insane in the P-Brane

First aired: 7/24/2009
Writer: Thania St. John
Director: Steve Miner
Guest star: Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana) , Jeff Pangman (Duncan), Brendan Beiser (Murray Drechmeyer), Chelah Horsdal (Mary-Beth Curtis), Mark Gash (H.J. Johnson), Rachel Gassi (The Dress Lady), Nikolas Longstaff (The Mail Carrier)
Global rating: 8.9

When objects begin moving on their own, Carter and newcomer Dr. Tess Fontana visit the "other side" to find the answer.

37. It's Not Easy Being Green

First aired: 7/31/2009
Writer: Curtis Kheel
Director: Sarah Pia Anderson
Guest star: Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Ever Carradine (Lexi Carter), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Jeff Pangman (Duncan), Sean Owen Roberts (Toby Bismark), Alan Legros (Seth Osbourne), John DeSantis (Big Ed Fowler)
Global rating: 8.8

When the bowling team from Area 51 hits town, the long-standing rivalry-cum-war is reignited, and a prank goes horribly wrong. Now Jack not only has to mediate between Area 51 and the home team to prevent more destruction, but also deal with the consequences of the first prank: a blob with an insatiable appetite. Elsewhere, Duncan returns to plead his case to a resistant Lexi.

38. If You Build It...

First aired: 8/7/2009
Writer: Bruce Miller (II)
Director: Mike Rohl
Guest star: Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman) , Jennifer Crystal Foley (Tabitha), Darryl Scheelar (Ranger Tom), D. Harlan Cutshall (GD Demo Team Leader), Eric Hempsall (Dr. Wyman)
Global rating: 9.2

A wave of wholesale looting hits Eureka as the signal draws closer, and when the missing objects turn up in a field as part of five towers built by the town's sleep-building teenagers it becomes a race against time to find the cause. Meanwhile, Fargo breaks up with his car causing the AI to seek revenge after she's sold to Haberman.

39. Ship Happens

First aired: 8/14/2009
Writer: Charlie Craig
Director: Chris Fisher (III)
Guest star: Tamlyn Tomita (Kim Yamazaki), Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana) , Ben Geldreich (Tom Lieber), Glynis Davies (Toaster Owner), Heather Doerksen (Woman #2)
Global rating: 9.2

Henry's 20-year-old project returns with more on board than it left with, and when a man is killed and another injured, Henry will have to face his past in order to save everyone's life. Back in town, Jo and Jack attempt to return the items from the towers to the owners with mixed results.

40. Shower the People

First aired: 8/21/2009
Writer: Thania St. John
Director: Stephen Surjik
Guest star: Tamlyn Tomita (Kim Yamazaki), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Bill Campbell (Bruce Manlius), Laura Mennell (Dr. Rivers), Stefanie Samuels (Dr. Draper), Jennifer Spence (Dr. Monroe), Meredith McGeachie (Dr. Bell), Stacey Barrington (GD Gym Manager), Bridget Hoffman (Computer Voice)
Global rating: 9.1

Jack investigates the deaths of scientists who drowned in less than liquid circumstances. Meanwhile, Allison's baby shower goes green.

41. You Don't Know Jack

First aired: 8/28/2009
Writer: Eric Wallace
Director: James Head
Guest star: Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent) , Bridget Hoffman (Computer Voice), Jillian Fargey (Dr. Ashe), Andrew Cownden (Dr. Bubay), Richard Side (Dr. Kinnison)
Global rating: 7.3

Tess begins a time capsule project for the town on the same day as Global Dynamic's annual sonic cleaning. Unfortunately, Fargo's attempt to erase history leaves some with a form of amnesia, and two people trapped in Section 5 with very little time to remember how to stop the cleaning – and no way to stop Allison's labor.

42. Have an Ice Day

First aired: 9/11/2009
Writer: Charlie Craig, Bruce Miller (II), Constance M. Burge, Joan Binder Weiss
Director: Joe Morton
Guest star: Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.) , Jay Brazeau (Captain Yuri Gregor)
Global rating: 8.9

The uneventful first day that Tess plans as the interim head of Global Dynamics is shattered by Taggart's reappearance and plunging temperatures caused by an ice core from the Arctic.

43. What Goes Around Comes Around

First aired: 9/18/2009
Writer: Jaime Paglia
Director: Matt Hastings
Guest star: Neil Grayston (S.A.R.A.H.), Christopher Gauthier (Vincent), Christopher Jacot (Larry Haberman), Vanya Asher (Lucas), Jaime Ray Newman (Tess Fontana), Adrienne Carter (Pilar Reed) , Leela Savasta (Julia Golden), Jonathan Nichols (Announcer)
Global rating: 9.2

Tess' reign as head of Global Dynamics may be shorter than planned after she receives an offer from Australia, the town deals with a magnetic disturbance and Jack must come to terms with Zoe leaving for college.
